text: In a boy with 2-methylbutyryl glycinuria (610006), whose parents were from Somalia, Madsen et al. (2006)identified a homozygous A-to-G transition in intron 3 of the ACADSB gene, resulting in the skipping of exon 3 as confirmed by mRNA analysis. The resultant mRNA likely leads to nonsense-mediated decay, but any residual protein was predicted to lack vital enzyme activity. Madsen et al. (2006) also identified the splice site mutation in 2 affected sibs previously reported by Gibson et al. (2000); see 600301.0002.
